CPT SALE CONTRACT

Contract No.: TRAMMO-CPT-2026-0019
Date: February 10, 2026

BETWEEN:
Trammo, Inc. â€” Ammonia Division ("Seller")
AND:
Koch Fertilizer LLC ("Buyer")

TRAMMO GENERAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS (CPT SALES)

1. PRODUCT AND SPECIFICATIONS

Product: Anhydrous Ammonia (NH3)
Product Specifications:
  Purity: minimum 99.5%
  Water: maximum 0.5%
  Oil: maximum 5 ppm

2. INCOTERMS

INCOTERMS 2020: CPT Buyer's terminal, Wever, Iowa.

3. PRICE

Price: US $395.00 per metric ton CPT Buyer's terminal. This is a fixed price
inclusive of truck freight from Seller's loading facility.

4. PAYMENT

Payment: By telegraphic transfer, net 30 days from delivery date. A standby
letter of credit may be requested at Seller's option.

5. LAYTIME AND DEMURRAGE

Loading Conditions: Trucks will be loaded at Seller's terminal.
Truck free time: 2 hours from arrival at loading rack.
Demurrage: $150 per hour for any time beyond the free hours, per day or
pro rata for any fraction thereof.

6. INSPECTION AND QUANTITY DETERMINATION

Inspection: Quantity shall be determined by certified scale weight at Seller's
truck load manifold. Alternatively, flow meter measurement may be used if
agreed by both parties. Seller's certified records shall be final and binding
for invoicing purposes.

7. DISCLAIMER OF WARRANTIES

Disclaimer of Warranties: SELLER MAKES NO WARRANTY, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED,
REGARDING THE PRODUCT, INCLUDING ANY WARRANTY OF MERCHANTABILITY OR
FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

8. CLAIMS

Claims: Any claim under this contract must be submitted within 90 calendar
days of delivery. Claims not submitted within such period shall be absolutely
barred.

9. DEFAULT AND REMEDIES

Default: If either party defaults on its obligations and fails to cure within
48 hours of written notice, the non-defaulting party may terminate. Late
payments shall bear interest at 1.5% per annum. Netting of mutual obligations
under this and other agreements is permitted.

10. FORCE MAJEURE

Force Majeure: Neither party shall be liable for non-performance caused by
Force Majeure, including without limitation acts of God, severe weather,
governmental restrictions, or transportation disruptions.

11. TAXES, FEES AND DUES

Taxes, Fees and Dues: All federal, state, and local taxes applicable to the
sale shall be added to the sale price and paid by Buyer. Seller shall be
responsible for any taxes at the point of origin.

12. NOTICES

Notices: All notices shall be deemed to be given when delivered via courier,
fax, or e-mail.

13. GOVERNING LAW AND ARBITRATION

Governing Law: This contract shall be governed by the laws of the State of
New York.
Arbitration: All disputes shall be resolved by arbitration under SMA rules
in New York.

14. MISCELLANEOUS

Miscellaneous: This constitutes the Entire Agreement. Modifications require
written consent. Waiver provisions apply. Assignment with consent only.
Severability of unenforceable provisions shall apply. No claim of sovereign
Immunity shall be asserted.
